archetype_name: Family Extra-Hot Chili Night (Caribbean & Mexican, 15–30, Simple)
name: Extra-Hot Habanero Chipotle Meatball Subs with Chili-Lime Corn
description: Spicy beef meatballs simmered in a habanero–chipotle tomato sauce, loaded into crusty bread and served with zesty chili-lime corn. A fast, fiery family dinner with Caribbean-Mexican heat.
prep_steps: If using an outdoor grill for corn, preheat to medium-high; otherwise set a large skillet on the stovetop.
Split bread lengthwise without cutting all the way through.
cook_steps: In a bowl, mix minced beef, half the chopped onion, half the garlic, allspice, ground cumin, chilli powder, salt, and black pepper until just combined.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat; sear meatballs on all sides until browned (4–5 minutes).
Reduce heat to medium. Add remaining onion and garlic to the skillet; cook 1 minute, stirring around the meatballs.
Pour in passata, stir in habanero sauce and chipotle sauce; simmer uncovered until meatballs are cooked through and sauce thickens (6–8 minutes).

While sauce simmers, cook corn: grill on OutdoorGrill, turning until lightly charred (6–8 minutes), or sauté kernels in a skillet with a little olive oil until tender and browned at spots (4–5 minutes).
Toss hot corn with chilli lime seasoning, a squeeze of lime, a pinch of salt, and half the chopped coriander.
Warm bread briefly on the grill or in a dry skillet. Spoon meatballs and spicy sauce into the bread. Top with remaining coriander and an extra drizzle of habanero sauce if desired.
Serve subs with the chili-lime corn on the side. Squeeze remaining lime over everything.
